attractions.name: National Museum of Colombo
attractions.description: The largest museum in Sri Lanka, housed in a grand colonial edifice. Displays the regalia of the Kandyan monarchs and offers a comprehensive overview of the country's pre-colonial past.

attractions.name: Gangaramaya Temple
attractions.description: An architectural fusion of Sri Lankan, Thai, Indian, and Chinese styles. Serves as a place of worship, a center of learning, and a repository of artifacts.

attractions.name: Seema Malaka
attractions.description: Designed by Geoffrey Bawa, this floating temple sits serenely on Beira Lake, offering a meditative space amidst the urban sprawl.

attractions.name: Jami Ul-Alfar Mosque (Red Mosque)
attractions.description: Striking red and white candy-striped brickwork makes this an architectural marvel and testament to Colombo's Islamic trading heritage.

attractions.name: Viharamahadevi Park
attractions.description: The city's largest and oldest park with flowering trees and fountains, serving as a green lung in Cinnamon Gardens.

attractions.name: Beddagana Wetland Park
attractions.description: Urban eco-tourism exemplar featuring boardwalks through biodiversity-rich marshlands. Critical habitat for migratory birds and butterflies.

attractions.name: Bolgoda Lake
attractions.description: The largest natural freshwater lake in Sri Lanka. Offers serene kayaking experiences through mangroves.

attractions.name: Dutch Period Museum
attractions.description: Located in the bustling Pettah district, preserves the architectural legacy of the Dutch East India Company.

attractions.name: Old Dutch Hospital
attractions.description: A heritage shopping and dining precinct housed in a restored colonial Dutch hospital building.

attractions.name: Independence Memorial Hall
attractions.description: A Kandyan-style monument commemorating the nation's independence from British rule in 1948.

attractions.name: Diyatha Uyana
attractions.description: Situated along the banks of the Diyawanna Oya, combines horticultural displays with walking tracks, popular for evening leisure and birdwatching.

attractions.name: Port City Colombo
attractions.description: Emerging urban adventure destination with facilities for ATV riding on artificial dunes and water sports.

attractions.name: Muthurajawela Wetland Sanctuary
attractions.description: A vast coastal peat swamp forest. Boat tours reveal a complex ecosystem of mangroves, crocodiles, monkeys, and diverse birdlife.

attractions.name: Henarathgoda Botanical Garden
attractions.description: Historic site where the first rubber seedlings in Asia were planted. Offers a rich collection of tropical flora.

attractions.name: Negombo Lagoon
attractions.description: Hub for water-based activities including boat safaris to observe traditional fishing methods and the mangrove ecosystem.

attractions.name: St. Mary's Church Negombo
attractions.description: Grand neoclassical structure with elaborate ceiling paintings. Negombo is known as 'Little Rome' for its Catholic heritage.

attractions.name: Angurukaramulla Temple
attractions.description: Famous for its colossal Buddha statue and a dragon entrance that leads to murals documenting the history of Sri Lankan kings.

attractions.name: Negombo Dutch Fort
attractions.description: Though largely in ruins, retains its gate and ramparts, currently housing a prison, adding a layer of living history.

attractions.name: Brief Garden
attractions.description: The landscape masterpiece of Bevis Bawa featuring overgrown paths, sculptures, and tropical foliage in artistic harmony.

attractions.name: Fa Hien Caves (Pahiyangala)
attractions.description: Archaeological site where prehistoric human remains were discovered. The hike offers panoramic rainforest views.

attractions.name: Kalutara Bodhiya
attractions.description: One of the most sacred Buddhist sites, distinguished by its hollow stupa (Chaitya) which visitors can enter.

attractions.name: Richmond Castle
attractions.description: An Edwardian mansion showcasing the grandeur and architectural fusion favored by early 20th-century philanthropists.

attractions.name: Bentota Water Sports Hub
attractions.description: The premier hub for water sports including jet skiing, windsurfing, and banana boat rides on the calm Bentota River.

attractions.name: Kande Vihara
attractions.description: Draws pilgrims with one of the tallest sitting Buddha statues in Sri Lanka and colorful murals depicting Jataka tales.

attractions.name: Thudugala Ella Waterfall
attractions.description: Popular bathing spot and scenic trek located within a rubber plantation.

attractions.name: Calido Beach
attractions.description: Unique spit of land separating the Kalu Ganga estuary from the ocean, offering distinct scenic views.

attractions.name: Galle Fort
attractions.description: UNESCO World Heritage Site - the best-preserved colonial sea fortress in Asia. A living city with Dutch architecture, museums, and cafes.

attractions.name: Kanneliya-Dediyagala-Nakiyadeniya Forest
attractions.description: UNESCO Biosphere Reserve rivaling Sinharaja in biodiversity. Features nature trails, waterfalls, and high endemicity of flora and fauna.

attractions.name: Madu River
attractions.description: Ramsar wetland famous for boat safaris through mangrove tunnels, visiting islands with cinnamon and ancient temples.

attractions.name: Hikkaduwa Marine National Park
attractions.description: Marine national park protecting coral reefs. Glass-bottom boat tours for viewing marine life.

attractions.name: Hikkaduwa Surf Point
attractions.description: Sri Lanka's primary surf zone featuring 'Main Reef' with diverse breaks suitable for intermediates.

attractions.name: Unawatuna Beach
attractions.description: Crescent-shaped bay with calm waters, perfect for swimming and snorkeling. One of Sri Lanka's most beautiful beaches.

attractions.name: Maritime Archaeology Museum
attractions.description: Housed in a Dutch warehouse within Galle Fort, showcases artifacts from shipwrecks around Galle harbor.

attractions.name: Kabalana Beach (The Rock)
attractions.description: Features 'The Rock', an A-frame reef break known for consistency and power, attracting advanced surfers.

attractions.name: Koggala Lagoon Kayaking
attractions.description: Calm water paddling through mangrove ecosystems. Also home to the Gin Ganga river kayaking.

attractions.name: Mirissa Whale Watching
attractions.description: Globally recognized whale-watching capital. Blue Whales and Sperm Whales spotted from November to April.

attractions.name: Polhena Beach
attractions.description: Protective reef creates shallow, calm waters frequented by resident sea turtles for easy snorkeling encounters.

attractions.name: Weligama Bay
attractions.description: Massive sand-bottomed bay universally recognized as the best place for beginner surfers in Sri Lanka.

attractions.name: Dondra Head Lighthouse
attractions.description: Marks the southernmost point of Sri Lanka. The tallest lighthouse in the country.

attractions.name: Star Fort
attractions.description: Unique Dutch military structure built in the shape of a six-pointed star, showcasing advanced 18th-century military architecture.

attractions.name: Weherahena Temple
attractions.description: Distinct cultural experience with underground tunnel complex adorned with murals leading to a colossal Buddha statue.

attractions.name: Kirala Kele Sanctuary
attractions.description: Wetland sanctuary near Matara town offering excellent birdwatching and kayaking opportunities.

attractions.name: Midigama Surf Point
attractions.description: Famous breaks like 'Lazy Left' and 'Rams' for intermediate and advanced surfers.

attractions.name: Yala National Park
attractions.description: The most visited park in Sri Lanka, famous for the highest leopard density in the world. Also home to elephants, sloth bears, and crocodiles.

attractions.name: Bundala National Park
attractions.description: UNESCO Biosphere Reserve and internationally important wintering ground for migratory waterbirds, particularly flamingos.

attractions.name: Kumana National Park
attractions.description: Renowned for the Kumana Villu mangrove swamp, a nesting site for multitudes of waterbirds.

attractions.name: Ussangoda National Park
attractions.description: Landscape of red soil and stunted vegetation, believed in folklore to be a landing site of King Ravana or a meteor impact.

attractions.name: Hummanaya Blowhole
attractions.description: The second-largest blowhole in the world, where sea water shoots high into the air through a natural rock fissure.

attractions.name: Temple of the Sacred Tooth Relic
attractions.description: The most sacred Buddhist site in Sri Lanka, housing the tooth relic of the Buddha. UNESCO World Heritage Site.

attractions.name: Royal Botanic Gardens Peradeniya
attractions.description: Renowned collection of orchids, spices, and the massive Javan Fig tree. Originally a royal pleasure garden.

attractions.name: Knuckles Mountain Range
attractions.description: UNESCO World Heritage site offering rugged trails through cloud forests, terraced paddy fields, and waterfalls. Biodiversity hotspot.

attractions.name: Embekke Devalaya
attractions.description: 14th-century temple known for exquisite wood carvings representing the Gampola period's artistic zenith.

attractions.name: Hanthana Mountain Range
attractions.description: Popular hiking destination offering panoramic views of Kandy city and the surrounding hills.

attractions.name: Sigiriya Rock Fortress
attractions.description: The '8th wonder of the world' - a 5th-century citadel on a magma plug. Famous for frescoes, mirror wall, and advanced hydraulics.

attractions.name: Dambulla Cave Temple
attractions.description: The largest and best-preserved cave temple complex in Sri Lanka, filled with statues and painted ceilings over two millennia old.

attractions.name: Pidurangala Rock
attractions.description: Challenging hike opposite Sigiriya providing the best vantage point to view the famous rock fortress.

attractions.name: Riverston & Mini World's End
attractions.description: Less commercialized trekking in the Knuckles range with dramatic viewpoint and windy gap.

attractions.name: Sembuwatta Lake
attractions.description: Man-made lake surrounded by pine forests, created from tea plantation water. A scenic mountain retreat.

attractions.name: Horton Plains National Park
attractions.description: High-altitude plateau ending at 'World's End' - a sheer 880-meter cliff drop. Home to sambar deer and unique cloud forest.

attractions.name: Moon Plains
attractions.description: Alternative to Horton Plains offering 'Mini World's End' with 360-degree views of surrounding peaks.

attractions.name: Victoria Park Nuwara Eliya
attractions.description: Well-maintained botanical space excellent for spotting Himalayan migrant birds in the cool climate.

attractions.name: Sri Maha Bodhi
attractions.description: The oldest human-planted tree in the world with a known planting date (288 BC). Sacred to Buddhists worldwide.

attractions.name: Ruwanwelisaya Stupa
attractions.description: Giant stupa enshrined with relics, one of the most sacred places of the Buddhist world.

attractions.name: Mihintale
attractions.description: The cradle of Buddhism in Sri Lanka. A mountain peak complex with a grand stairway and ancient hospital ruins.

attractions.name: Isurumuniya Temple
attractions.description: Rock temple famous for stone carvings including the 'Isurumuniya Lovers' and elephant pond carvings.

attractions.name: Wilpattu National Park
attractions.description: The largest national park in Sri Lanka, known for unique 'Villu' (natural lakes) and prime leopard, sloth bear sightings.

attractions.name: Gal Vihara
attractions.description: Masterpiece of rock-cut Buddha statues - seated, standing, and reclining - carved from a single granite face.

attractions.name: Polonnaruwa Ancient City
attractions.description: UNESCO World Heritage medieval capital with the Royal Palace, Quadrangle (Dalada Maluwa), and Vatadage.

attractions.name: Minneriya National Park
attractions.description: Famous for 'The Gathering' (July-October) where hundreds of elephants congregate - one of Asia's greatest wildlife spectacles.

attractions.name: Kaudulla National Park
attractions.description: Alternative elephant gathering location when Minneriya water levels rise. Part of the elephant corridor.

attractions.name: Ethagala (Elephant Rock)
attractions.description: Massive rock outcrop topped with a giant Buddha statue. Panoramic views of the city and surrounding lakes.

attractions.name: Yapahuwa Rock Fortress
attractions.description: 13th-century capital with dramatic ornamental staircase resembling Cambodian styles. A steep climb to summit ruins.

attractions.name: Ridi Viharaya (Silver Temple)
attractions.description: Temple born from a silver ore discovery that funded the Ruwanwelisaya. Features Kandyan-era frescoes and Dutch tiles.

attractions.name: Arankele Monastery
attractions.description: Serene forest monastery ruins with meditation pathways and massive hot water baths used by ancient monks.

attractions.name: Kalpitiya Peninsula
attractions.description: Global kitesurfing hotspot. Sanctuary for Spinner Dolphins (thousands in pods) and seasonal Sperm Whales.

attractions.name: Pigeon Island National Park
attractions.description: Premier snorkeling experience in Sri Lanka. Swim with Blacktip Reef Sharks and sea turtles around coral reefs.

attractions.name: Nilaveli Beach
attractions.description: Long stretch of pristine white sand and crystal blue water on the east coast.

attractions.name: Koneswaram Temple
attractions.description: The 'Temple of a Thousand Pillars' perched atop Swami Rock. Dramatic cliffside views of the Indian Ocean.

attractions.name: Kanniya Hot Springs
attractions.description: Complex of seven wells with varying temperatures, steeped in legend associated with King Ravana.

attractions.name: Pasikudah Beach
attractions.description: Famous for shallow, calm waters protected by a reef. Walk hundreds of meters into the sea - ideal for families.

attractions.name: Batticaloa Lagoon
attractions.description: Massive estuarine system known for the phenomenon of 'Singing Fish' and traditional prawn fishing.

attractions.name: Arugam Bay
attractions.description: World-renowned surf destination with Main Point, Whiskey Point (beginner), and Peanut Farm breaks.

attractions.name: Gal Oya National Park
attractions.description: Unique boat safari on Senanayake Samudraya reservoir where you can see elephants swimming between islands.

attractions.name: Lahugala Kitulana National Park
attractions.description: Smaller park famous for the gathering of elephants around Lahugala Tank to feed on Beru grass.

attractions.name: Nallur Kandaswamy Kovil
attractions.description: The most significant Hindu temple in the north, known for grand festivals and strict adherence to rituals.

attractions.name: Jaffna Fort
attractions.description: Massive Dutch fortification overlooking the lagoon. Symbol of the region's colonial and conflict history.

attractions.name: Delft Island (Neduntheevu)
attractions.description: Remote island with wild horses descended from Dutch mounts, baobab trees, and coral walls.

attractions.name: Casuarina Beach
attractions.description: The most famous beach in the north, known for shallow waters and beautiful Casuarina trees.

attractions.name: Nagadeepa Purana Vihara
attractions.description: Buddhist pilgrimage site on Nainativu island reached by boat. Sacred to both Buddhists and Hindus.

attractions.name: Adam's Bridge (Rama Setu)
attractions.description: Chain of limestone shoals stretching towards India. Boat tours to sandbanks in shimmering shallow waters.

attractions.name: Vankalai Sanctuary
attractions.description: Haven for migratory birds including large flocks of flamingos.

attractions.name: Mannar Baobab Trees
attractions.description: Massive living monuments planted centuries ago by Arab traders, testament to the region's trade history.

attractions.name: Thiruketheeswaram Temple
attractions.description: One of the five ancient Ishwarams of Lord Shiva with intricate Dravidian architecture.

attractions.name: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
attractions.description: The holiest Catholic shrine in Sri Lanka, located in the jungle and drawing pilgrims from all faiths.

attractions.name: Iranamadu Tank
attractions.description: Vast reservoir serving as the lifeline of the north, offering scenic views and picnic spots.

attractions.name: Elephant Pass
attractions.description: Strategic isthmus connecting the mainland to Jaffna peninsula. Features war memorials and salt pans.

attractions.name: Nanthikadal Lagoon
attractions.description: Ecologically and historically significant lagoon, now a peaceful site for birdwatching and fishing.

attractions.name: Kokkilai Bird Sanctuary
attractions.description: Vital sanctuary for estuarine birds on the Trincomalee border.

attractions.name: Archaeological Museum Vavuniya
attractions.description: Houses diverse artifacts including Buddha statues and Hindu sculptures from the region.

attractions.name: Madukanda Vihara
attractions.description: Believed to be a resting place of the Sacred Tooth Relic during its journey to Anuradhapura.

attractions.name: Ella Rock
attractions.description: Challenging hike through tea plantations and eucalyptus forests with views of the southern plains.

attractions.name: Little Adam's Peak
attractions.description: Easier hike with stunning 360-degree views of Ella Gap and surrounding mountains.

attractions.name: Nine Arch Bridge
attractions.description: Engineering marvel in Demodara where visitors walk along tracks to watch trains pass through beautiful scenery.

attractions.name: Diyaluma Falls
attractions.description: Sri Lanka's second-highest waterfall (220m) famous for natural infinity pools at the top.

attractions.name: Bambarakanda Falls
attractions.description: Sri Lanka's tallest waterfall at 263m, resembling a thin horsetail through the forest.

attractions.name: Dunhinda Falls
attractions.description: Known for its smoky spray, this waterfall near Badulla town requires a scenic forest hike to reach.

attractions.name: Kataragama Sacred City
attractions.description: Multi-religious sacred city visited by Buddhists, Hindus, and Muslims. Famous for fire-walking rituals.

attractions.name: Maligawila Buddha Statue
attractions.description: World's tallest free-standing ancient limestone Buddha statue in a forest setting.

attractions.name: Buduruwagala
attractions.description: Ancient rock-cut Buddha figures carved into a cliff, showing Mahayana Buddhist influence.

attractions.name: Sinharaja Forest Reserve
attractions.description: UNESCO World Heritage site - the last viable primary tropical rainforest. Hotspot for endemic birds like the Blue Magpie.

attractions.name: Adam's Peak (Sri Pada)
attractions.description: Sacred mountain pilgrimage site. The Ratnapura routes (Palabaddala/Erathna) are classic arduous paths through wilderness.

attractions.name: Bopath Ella
attractions.description: Popular waterfall shaped like a Bo (Bodhi) leaf, easily accessible and scenic.

attractions.name: Udawalawe National Park
attractions.description: Renowned for guaranteed elephant sightings year-round. Home to the Elephant Transit Home for orphaned calves.

attractions.name: Pinnawala Elephant Orphanage
attractions.description: Captive breeding and conservation center famous for the daily river bathing ritual of the elephant herd.

attractions.name: Kitulgala
attractions.description: Adventure capital famous for white-water rafting, canyoning, and as the filming location for 'The Bridge on the River Kwai'.

attractions.name: Bible Rock (Bathalegala)
attractions.description: Scenic hike up a distinctive square-shaped rock offering panoramic views of the surrounding valleys.
